stories.text: Does anyone want to work with me and engineer or market a $5,000 tiny home — the blueprints will be open source, but also manufacture at scale if there is demand. This home would have a solar roof, small battery, water tank, will arrive in a IKEA-like box worldwide. It should allow a 6.5 ft person sleep comfortably and should be movable with a forklift. Think a next generation home for the homeless. Should withstand regular weather for 20 years. DM me. I could invest some $50k to start this venture if we can form a team.
stories.title: Ask HN: Tiny Home for $5k USD?
India has spent a decade wasting the potential of its young population

stories.text:
Merry Xmas and happy holidays HN. I rarely post here but would like the community's help.

In short, my high spend (platinum, on track to be diamond?) 7-year-old Uber account was banned yesterday, and I have been trapped in a Kafka-esque, situation with support saying they will/cannot do anything. Support did drop a hint that my account has seen suspicious activity.

I am turning HN for help, e.g. if someone could get me in touch with more sympathetic/"human" channels. (From experience, it seems like sometimes HN could get Uber's attention in cases such as this.)

Thanks all!

--

The timeline of events is the following:

1. I got a new phone, and setup my credit card in Apple Pay, but didn't enter the CVV code. 2. Uber App on the new phone defaulted to the new card (seems to be a bug on Apple's end). 3. Payment was rejected, which is probably the suspicious activity trigger.

I reached out to support and subsequently was told my account was banned. Further communications were stonewalled.
stories.title: Ask HN: Uber account wrongly banned for suspected fraud – any recourse?
